intro: Secamone varia var. varia, commonly known as the variable secamone, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a slight reddish tinge. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that splits open to release seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
